items.text: I trust my gut feelings when making decisions.
items.rationale: Reliance on intuition is a key aspect of the Experiential System.

items.text: She often acts on impulse without overthinking.
items.rationale: Impulsive behavior is characteristic of the Experiential System.

items.text: I feel more comfortable when I follow my instincts.
items.rationale: Comfort with instinctual decision-making aligns with the Experiential System.

items.text: He tends to go with the flow rather than plan everything out.
items.rationale: Preference for spontaneity is indicative of the Experiential System.

items.text: I often rely on my emotions to guide my choices.
items.rationale: Emotional guidance is a hallmark of the Experiential System.

items.text: She makes decisions based on how she feels in the moment.
items.rationale: Momentary feelings influencing decisions is typical of the Experiential System.

items.text: I prefer to act first and think later.
items.rationale: Acting before thinking is a trait of the Experiential System.

items.text: He often follows his heart rather than his head.
items.rationale: Following one's heart is a key feature of the Experiential System.

items.text: I enjoy making spontaneous decisions.
items.rationale: Spontaneity is a defining characteristic of the Experiential System.

items.text: She trusts her first impressions of people.
items.rationale: Trusting first impressions is aligned with the Experiential System.

items.text: I often act on a whim.
items.rationale: Acting on whims is typical of the Experiential System.

items.text: He feels that his emotions are a reliable guide.
items.rationale: Reliance on emotions for guidance is characteristic of the Experiential System.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to distinguish between my feelings and my thoughts.
items.rationale: Difficulty distinguishing feelings from thoughts can indicate a strong Experiential System, but may also suggest emotional complexity.

items.text: She often feels that her emotions are more accurate than logical analysis.
items.rationale: Preference for emotions over logic suggests the Experiential System, but could also imply a lack of trust in rationality.

items.text: I sometimes make decisions based on a mix of intuition and logic.
items.rationale: This could map to the Rational System due to the inclusion of logic.

items.text: I prefer to analyze all the details before making a decision.
items.rationale: Detail-oriented analysis is a core aspect of the Rational System.

items.text: He often creates detailed plans before taking action.
items.rationale: Planning and forethought are characteristic of the Rational System.

items.text: I rely on facts and evidence to guide my decisions.
items.rationale: Fact-based decision-making is a hallmark of the Rational System.

items.text: She prefers logical reasoning over emotional responses.
items.rationale: Preference for logic over emotion is indicative of the Rational System.

items.text: I enjoy solving complex problems using logic.
items.rationale: Problem-solving through logic is a defining feature of the Rational System.

items.text: He often weighs the pros and cons before deciding.
items.rationale: Weighing pros and cons is typical of the Rational System.

items.text: I feel more comfortable when I have a clear plan.
items.rationale: Comfort with planning aligns with the Rational System.

items.text: She uses data to support her arguments.
items.rationale: Data-driven arguments are characteristic of the Rational System.

items.text: I prefer to think things through thoroughly.
items.rationale: Thorough thinking is a trait of the Rational System.

items.text: He often double-checks his work for accuracy.
items.rationale: Double-checking for accuracy is aligned with the Rational System.

items.text: I like to have all the information before making a choice.
items.rationale: Gathering complete information is typical of the Rational System.

items.text: She often questions assumptions before accepting them.
items.rationale: Questioning assumptions suggests a Rational System, but could also indicate skepticism.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to trust my emotions over logic.
items.rationale: Difficulty trusting emotions suggests a Rational System, but may also reflect emotional uncertainty.

items.text: I often use both logic and intuition to make decisions.
items.rationale: This could map to the Experiential System due to the inclusion of intuition.
